intro: Cordula amabilis, commonly known as the sweet cordula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cordula amabilis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
